__e: Well, you don't mind us, preacher, we don't mind you.
I don't know what really happened with your son, Julia...
- You had something with Maggie, but she was living with Don and your heart was a little dinged up, so you wanted to get out of town for a while and that's why you weren't available to do your job,
You both have been working for me, even if you didn't know about each other, and now is not the time to grow a conscience unless you want to face a jail cell.
You were not up at night in the office, you were up at night at home?
Are you telling me you didn't know?
I don't know what would have happened to us if you hadn't been the people that you are.
I noticed you weren't at the party, so I thought... if there is anything you would like for me to do, I would be happy to.
Well... actually, you weren't... there, I was alone in the dark, but... you know, it sure seemed like you were.
Then I realized you're just men.
Well, you know, your dad took off on you when you were a kid.
There were no other witnesses to this proclamation?
Yes, I am a silly girl... for not having seen sooner that you were nothing but a coward... with a heart full of fear.
When you were a boy at home... how many, many times did you ask us:
Till last night you were just a name on my list.
- Hélène told me you weren't in your room. I was sleeping.
I have been wanting to ask you something.... the other night I saw you at the station you were standing all alone... the train came, and I turned to look at you and you had walked away...
Because the last time I talked to him, he had told me that you hadn't been in touch.
All those facts and figures I saw of The Doctor's life, you were never alone.
- But the fact remains, many who have been killed would be alive today if you had never come here.
And you and your husband, you couldn't agree on one thing.
You know, when I was in the service... back in the war... that was before you were born...
You seem to know this beyond all reasonable doubt, in fact, which, given you weren't even there...
You know, when I was in the service... back in the war... that was before you were born...
You seem to know this beyond all reasonable doubt, in fact, which, given you weren't even there...
